title: Funniest LoL experiences
body:
Post your funniest experiences playing LoL. First prize is a {{item:1058}} .

Mine are:

1- First day playing LoL I thought Veigar bot was a weird looking minion and got wrecked. I thought he was some sort of badass minion until someone explained it to me.

2- While playing a ranked game with a friend a roach {{champion:121}} jumped onto his desk and he starting freaking out and afked in the middle of the lane for 10 minutes. We actually won that game.

3- My friend and I were doing mystery gift trades. He got Shockblade Zed (he's a Zed main) and I got Galio{{champion:3}} -.-

replies.body:
I remember when my cousin and two brothers started playing league, I challenged them to a 3v1.

I went AD {{champion:16}} and killed all of them 50~ times, and eventually lost due to them grouping. Machine banana gun of death!

"Yes, that was a banana. No one expects the banana" - {{champion:16}} 

"The unseen banana is the deadliest" {{champion:238}}

When I first started back in 2010, I had no idea what summoner spells did (because reading was apparently really hard at the time), and got really upset when I brought smite mid, and couldn't use it on my opponent. 

Oh! The first time I got a quadra kill, I was really excited. I was telling my friend about it later that day, and his response was, "Oh, you killed the wraith camp?"

Lol I couldn't smite Veigar either :c

Can you make Riot fix that pls?  I mean I kept spamming smite on Veigar and nothing happened.

Soo... Did you kill the wraith camp or was that a lie?
I got a legit quadra. :c
Sure, I believe you ;)
xD

5 man jungle game.
Level 8 Baron.
Nuff said
that is what i like to call a tribute to the jungle book!!
Did you win though?
well my teammate got a penta aced and decided to dance at baron the entire game....

Pre-season 1, possibly Late Beta
Tri-lane bot
full Crit rune page {{champion:36}} with Red Elixir and E to start
{{champion:14}}  Starting Stun
{{champion:44}}  Starting Stun

First blood every game

my friends brother was saying how bad we were so he challenged us a to a 2v2 we went {{champion:127}} & {{champion:10}} Liss was invulnable for 6 seconds, they still thinks its a bullshit way to win 
"duh theres no way we're letting them win"

I had several funny moments. One was in a game on jungle Rammus. At the start of the game, I take my blue, got to take my red, but the opposing junger, Wukong, took my red. I then rush over to his red to see if it's there. It was still there, so I took it. I go back to my own jungle, and their Wukong catches me out in my own jungle when we both were at around half health. We fight each other, somehow I end up actually getting the kill on Wukong. I then typed in all chat "That's what you get for taking my blue"

Another game, this time playing jungle Braum on Purple side, my team ends up losing a skirmish in the top lane, leaving me alone to defend myself. I run over to the top lane brushes, and as the opposing Twisted Fate and Thresh tried to cut me off from getting back to my team's top lane outer turret, I juke them by running over to the blue side outer turret, and escape by running through the turret and through the jungle back to the rest of my team.

On one of the few somewhat recent games I played on Cho'gath top, I remember skirmishes in the mid game where I would sometimes use my rupture well behind the enemy Caitlyn, only to watch her net into my rupture.

Another game on Rammus top I had this funny situation where around 50% of my kills would come from the opposing team towerdiving me, whether it was the opposing team's jungle Hecarim trying to dive me to get a kill or a teamfight where I was 2-3 items in on my build against the relatively low damage of the enemy team's front line. I got a triple kill in that team fight just because the enemy team decided to towerdive me.

After watching my friend ruin the enemy team as critplank{{champion:41}} I managed to convince him to teach me to play this game, since I was new I bought the best l champion I could afford, poppy in my mind {{champion:78}}, and lined up in a 1v1. Due to a severe lack of attention on his behalf to attempting any sort of respectable cs (he was too busy mocking my "terrible" choice in first champion) I managed to beat him in  a poppy vs gangplank in my first ever game :D

When I first started playing League, I knew absolutely nothing and ended up very confused during my first week of playing.

 In my very first game, my friend was trying to teach me the basics in a bot game, with me playing Ezreal and him playing Blizcrank. I didn't understand it at the time, but he had bought a Zhonya's. I had no idea what it was, so when he grabbed a bot and zhonyas'd to save my life, I spent the next 2 weeks or so thinking that Blitcrank had an ability that turned him invulnerable. In my first game as Blitz, I was trying to figure out which ability that was and was severely disappointed.{{item:3070}}

I think my funniest time was playing as {{champion:98}} during U.R.F. The 1v5, kill 3, get out. A lot of hilarious things happened in U.R.F.

Another funny thing is when I was on PBE playing gnar. As I run away from them I kept just spamming emotes. It lured them into my turret where they all died. 

Apparently gnar's emotes when spammed are like super taunts. I can't wait for him to come out.
Lel that's funny and Gnar sounds like the most hellish yordle to date. Maybe he will be more annoying than He Who Shall Not Be Played {{champion:17}} .
None shall be more annoying than He Who Shall Not Be Played.

Dat bear though right? 

"In my day we would have never let an armored bear into the league" {{champion:26}}

When I was a lowly bronzie back in season 2, I played a decent amount of {{champion:117}}  support. I was playing support primarily because nobody else wanted it, back before Sightstone and fancy gold generation items, and {{champion:117}}  was a go-to for a while until I encountered {{champion:44}} , back when he was OP.

Anyway, in this game, a fight broke out with a lot of spells flying everywhere, and I accidentally stole one of the kills. Unfortunately, either on that kill or on another kill, I got red buff, which meant that not only did I have the ksing machine you don't expect on {{champion:117}}'s passive, you also had red buff adding a DoT to give me my first unofficial pentakill. We almost lost because I took so much gold from those 5 kills, but we managed to close it out, anyway.

1. I was still in bronze, S3 as a support main. (so i wasn't leaving bronze anytime soon.) But i had gotten so good with Thresh, (3 to 4 nerfs ago) i got a triple kill under turret by myself. Killed the adc, jungler, and mid. Also attained double buffs.

2. Mystery gift trading with brother. He got SG Udyr. I got pulsefire Ez. XD
Well you beat me at least. I wish I had you and your brother's luck.

I'm kinda famous among my friends for often (accidentally) killstealing as {{champion:37}} . As such, there are a couple of things that have happened that come to mind:

1 - E, flash, Q, AA an enemy ADC that was about to escape under the enemy inhibitor turret (after everyone else had given up). Got a "Muerte Sona" into chat from the enemy :D

2 - After a particularly dramatic bout of nabbing kills my friends on skype went "Just buy {{item:3041}} already and carry!" They may have been sarcastic at first, but I did, and then proceeded to be a fully stacked murder machine. >:3

3 - Something more recent and irrelevant to Sona, but it's really just so much fun to play {{champion:45}} support and still POP the enemy AP carry solo, even from a losing position :p

I can't remember very many funny experiences (My memory is terrible), but I do remember a few days ago...

I was playing Vi, and Q'd into an Amumu's Bandage Toss. The resulting collision leveled the Rift. (Not really, but it knocked him back and interrupted his pull. T'was hilarious)

when I first started playing league back in s2, I went top as Amumu with Smite. I thought smite would surely destroy the enemy champion. I guess I didn't read the tooltip correctly. I actually uninstalled the game soon after, only to start playing again a year later

In a recent game as Thresh I was playing against a lane that had a twitch.  We had just taken their turret I believe and twitch was super low. He stealthed and so I threw out death sentence... and boom, dying twitch animation.

One time, in an ARAM as Ezreal, my team had the others down to less than 200 points, each but couldn't finish them off.  One Trueshot Barrage later and I got a Quadra-Kill (missed the Penta by a few pixels, apparently.)
My friend and I were playing ranked and I was helping him through his promos and some how he jumped from bronze 4 to bronze 2 now beating me in rank >:( Someone explain how that happens.
If you do really well. Like better than the system thinks you should do then you can jump divisions and sometimes even whole tiers.
I blind shot a {{champion:51}} q into the dragon pit and just happened to steal it. No wards or anything.
Hah nice :P
